Take Down Requests

If your material has been included in our digital collections, you can request that it be removed from public view.

More Information

If your material has been included in our digital collections, you can request that it be removed from public view. We encourage you to consider this carefully; the goal of all of our digital collections and services is to preserve and provide access to important scholarly information for present and future generations.

If you are the copyright owner or have other rights-related concerns and do not wish for your materials to be included in our digital collections or on our web site, you can request that your materials be archived and preserved, but restricted from public view by contacting the MEAP team at the UCLA Library at meap@library.ucla.edu.

The UCLA Library Modern Endangered Archives Program is supported by Arcadia.
